page.title: 16Sandal Church, Wakefield
page.content: Sandal Church is dedicated to {St.Helen.}The first patron of the church was Edward the Confessor. In the first{Domesday Book}there were two churches in Wakefield of which Sandal was one. In the year 1150 a new church was built in the shap of a cross. In the year of the{Black Death 1349}the church was rebuilt.The next thing to be added was a Chantry Chapel. In 1872 the church was lengthened by two bays to the west, the south porch was taken down and the north door was replaced by a three light window.In 1895 a small chapel was built and consecrated by{William Walsham Howe,}the first Bishop of Wakefield.On the reredos is carved the Last Supper.The credence table is made of olive wood from the Mount of Olives.The present day vicar is Mr.Strapps.
